content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for function `clean_column`:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ _-]+" => "_")
end
```

This function will convert the input string to lower case, remove any leading or trailing whitespaces and then replace all spaces and hyphens with underscores. The `r` in front of `"[ _-]+"` is for regular expressions.
